description: Number of multi-directed animals on the triangular lattice.
comments: Counts certain animals that generalize directed animals. They are also equinumerous with a class of n-ominoes studied by Klarner in 1967.
references: M. Bousquet-Mélou and A. Rechnitzer, Lattice animals and heaps of dimers, Discrete Math. 258 (2002), no. 1-3, 235-274.
D. A. Klarner, Cell growth problems, Canad. J. Math. 19 (1967) 851-863.
links: M. Bousquet-Mélou and A. Rechnitzer, Lattice animals and heaps of dimers
J.-P. Bultel, S. Giraudo, Combinatorial Hopf algebras from PROs, arXiv preprint arXiv:1406.6903, 2014
formula: The generating function is known in closed form. It is big and non-D-finite.Bultel-Giraudo (2014), Prop. 3.2, give a g.f. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Sep 21 2014
author: _Mireille Bousquet-Mélou_, Feb 08 2001
